This option redirects you to the activity to learn about the application and the developer.
"This option redirects you to the activity to send an email to the developer. "
This image is the picture of the cardview to display in the recycler view

Chaotic in appearance, these tangled filaments of shocked, glowing gas are spread across planet Earth\'s sky toward the constellation of Cygnus as part of the Veil Nebula. The Veil Nebula itself is a large supernova remnant, an expanding cloud born of the death explosion of a massive star. Light from the original supernova explosion likely reached Earth over 5,000 years ago. The glowing filaments are really more like long ripples in a sheet seen almost edge on, remarkably well separated into the glow of ionized hydrogen atoms shown in blue and oxygen in red hues. Also known as the Cygnus Loop and cataloged as NGC 6979, the Veil Nebula now spans about 6 times the diameter of the full Moon. The length of the wisp corresponds to about 30 light years, given its estimated distance of 2,400 light years. Often identified as Pickering\'s Triangle for a director of Harvard College Observatory, it is also named for its discoverer, astronomer Williamina Fleming, as Fleming\'s Triangular Wisp.
Wait for the image to load

Enter your name along with your email address to start your registration.
Enter a password and retype it below to compare if they are the same. Must be longer than eight characters

The password must have a minimum of 8 characters
Click on the icon above to select your profile picture.

This option is intended to go to the application settings fragment.
Find wonderful images of the cosmos and add them to your favorites
Click on the icon to search for images that are stored in your local database. For example, search for today\'s date in this format: YYYY-MM-DD

Would you like to download a translator to switch from English to the language of your phone? It works with and without internet. It is by the Firebase machine learning kit. It\'s not the best but it works. It weighs about 30 Mb
Downloading… this will take a few minutes.
There was an error downloading translator.

Some of these images are in very high resolutions. If some of them don\'t load or you get kicked out of the app, it\'s probably because your phone doesn\'t support the resolution of the photo or because the file was too big. If you want to lower the resolution and be able to see all the images without any problem, you can go to Settings -> Storage -> Image Resolution -> Low. Sorry for the inconvenience.
Sorry, the translator from English to the language of your phone is not available, it has not been created yet. We will have to wait for future updates. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Hahaha how funny… you can\'t request future dates to today\'s dates!
Check that everything is spelled correctly or try different keywords.
To reload all the images, press the icon but without text
DailyCosmos is an application that brings a new photograph of the cosmos every day. Free and without ads.
Discover more than 100,000 photos of the universe from the comfort of your cell phone. In addition, you can download the image in its maximum resolution.
Finally, you can create a free account to store your favorites and save them in the stars.
Wait until the download is finished
Press the button below to try again
Please don\'t request more than 31 days

This time it\'s a video/animation/simulation. Unfortunately it\'s not possible to play them from here, but if you like, you can press the icon below to copy the link and visit the site from your browser.
Verify that your Internet connection is good. If this error keeps happening, it is very likely that the service by NASA has stopped for a few minutes.
Your request arrived with an empty response. Please try again or wait a few minutes in case it still fails.
Select dates. Do not choose more than 31 days
Would you like to create an account and store your favorites in the cloud? It\'s free and it won\'t take more than five minutes.
